head_office_address: Eaton Court Road, 1 Colmworth Business Park
eu_initiatives: Public health, research and innovation, active and healthy ageing, civil rights
organisation_name: The National Advisory Council to the Thalidomide Trust (NAC)
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
relevant_communication: The NAC conducts a civil rights campaign for compensation of thalidomide survivors. The activityi at the European Parliament is aimed at receiving support from MEPs for this campaign. A joint press conference of EPP, S&D, ECR on 27th May 2015 and a debate in the Parliament on 9 March 2016 constituted milestones of this activity.
legal_status: None - user led advisory body to a disability organisation, the Thalidomide Trust. The Thalidomide Trust is a Trust under British law registered charity no. 266220 held on 4 th July 2008 at 16 Old Bailey
goals__remit:
The National Advisory Council (NAC) to the Thalidomide Trust is a user led advisory body to a disability organisation. It conforms to the concept of user led and empowered participation in decision making processes of a disability organisation. 
 
The NAC also advocates on the national UK and European level the plight of Thalidomide survivors and to achieve appropriate financial compensation and recognition of their plight.
